content: Within six months, Sabrina will stack 5 one-inch blocks independently in 4 out of 5 opportunities with no more than 2 verbal prompts, to improve visual-motor coordination and hand stability for age-appropriate play skills.

Within six months, Sabrina will string 3-4 large beads onto a string in 4 out of 5 opportunities with moderate assistance, demonstrating bilateral hand use and midline crossing during fine motor activities.

Within six months, Sabrina will use a tripod or quadrupod grasp to hold a crayon and make controlled marks on paper in 4 out of 5 opportunities with minimal prompts, promoting pre-writing skill development.
Within six months, Sabrina will complete a 4-piece puzzle independently in 4 out of 5 opportunities, demonstrating improved visual-perceptual skills and problem-solving abilities.
Within six months, Sabrina will transition between activities with no more than 1 verbal prompt in 4 out of 5 opportunities, improving behavioral regulation and attention skills.
Within six months, Sabrina will demonstrate age-appropriate self-feeding skills using utensils with minimal assistance in 4 out of 5 meal opportunities.
Within six months, Sabrina will independently participate in a 10-minute structured group activity with peers, demonstrating improved social participation and engagement.

Within six months, Sabrina will perform at least three animal walks (e.g., bear walk, crab walk) across a distance of 10 feet with 80% accuracy in proper form, to enhance gross motor coordination and strength.
